name: Microservices (Java + Scala)
description: Spotify uses microservices architecture in Java and Scala to scale independent teams and services across its backend.

name: Apache Kafka
description: Kafka is used for real‑time data streaming of user events and actions across Spotify’s systems.

name: Apache Cassandra
description: Spotify relies on Cassandra as a distributed NoSQL datastore for scale, availability, and cross‑region load.

name: Luigi
description: Spotify built Luigi for ETL pipeline orchestration on Hadoop, scheduling thousands of batch data jobs.

name: Scio (Scala + Beam)
description: Scio is Spotify’s Scala API for Apache Beam running on Dataflow to unify batch/stream processing.

name: Google Cloud Platform
description: Spotify migrated from on‑prem to GCP to run infrastructure, BigQuery analytics, Kubernetes, and storage.

name: Fleet Management Automation
description: Spotify employs fleet management to automate patching, upgrades, and library versioning across services.

name: Backstage Kubernetes plugin
description: Custom Backstage plugin for Kubernetes observability tailored to service‑owner workflows in Spotify.

name: Service Discovery via DNS SRV
description: Spotify uses DNS SRV records as a service registry/discovery mechanism across internal microservices.

name: gRPC + Protobuf
description: Modern service‑to‑service RPC communication in Spotify uses gRPC with Protobuf for efficiency.

name: Prometheus & Grafana
description: Spotify uses Prometheus and Grafana for metrics collection, alerting, and observability across services.

name: ELK Stack / Datadog
description: Logging infrastructure built on ELK stack (Elasticsearch‑Logstash‑Kibana), often augmented with Datadog.

name: Apache Spark
description: Spotify uses Spark for large‑scale data processing and machine learning workloads.

name: Apache Storm
description: Storm was used for real‑time processing like ad targeting and product metrics.

name: React + Redux + Sass
description: Frontend stack: React for UI, Redux for state management, Sass for styling in Spotify’s web client.

name: Docker / Kubernetes
description: Docker containers orchestrated by Kubernetes for deploying Spotify’s microservices globally.

name: Voyager (Spotify NN search library)
description: Voyager is Spotify’s open‑source nearest‑neighbor search library combining HNSW accuracy and speed.

name: Basic Pitch
description: Basic Pitch is Spotify’s ML‑based audio‑to‑MIDI converter for note transcription tasks.

name: Graph Neural Networks for audiobook recommendations
description: Spotify pioneered the use of HGNN + Two‑Tower models to improve audiobook recommendation accuracy.

name: HBase for ML/Hadoop
description: Spotify employs HBase as storage backend for Hadoop and machine learning workloads.
